result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus J Kerby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marcus J Kerby is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges. On one or more other charges, Marcus J Kerby was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marcus J Kerby is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Marcus J Kerby was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Marcus J Kerby was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Marcus J Kerby was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CASH BOND SET - $500 PER CASE - DCPS REFERRAL. 
- If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS). The defendant shall report to DCPS by 10:00 AM on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with C.E.N.
- The Court finds substantial evidence that knowing and malicious prevention or dissuasion of the above victim(s) is reasonably likely to occur.  The above conditions of release are hereby ordered pursuant to Sec. 940.47 and Chapter 969.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Cole Daniel Ruby.  Jessica Miller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. RE: Defn's Motion to Vacate JOC. ADA Miller advises teh State is not planning on appealing. CT makes findings and vacates JOC on cts 1, 2, 3, 6 and 7. Cts 4 and 5 remain unchanged. Colloquy w/ counsel; RE: Weapon Enhancer within ct 7 where the jury answered "no" within the verdict. CT brackets decision. Atty Ruby to draft proposed order vacating JOC. Atty Ruby advised defn's revocation sentence was concluded in 2013 and is currently serving time on this sentence. CT to set bail.

Entered in error
Entered in error

Regarding Post-Conviction Motion for a New Trial-ORDER: For reasons explained in the decision, the Court concludes that the defn is entitle to a new trial, and Orders that the Defn's motion is hereby GRANTED. In consultation with the parties, as a result of this Order, the Court will formally vacate the Judgment of Conviction, and order the Department of Corrections return the Defn to Dane County for proceedings consistent with this Order. The Decision and Order is a final decision for purposes of appeal. Copy of decision and order mailed to Defn and DOC.

Court Reporter: Philip Harrelson - Motion on Post-Conviction Hearing, May 7, 2018

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Cole Daniel Ruby.  Jessica Miller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Colloquy w/ counsel and defn on waiving atty/client privilege in regards to Defn's motion. Defn waives atty/client privilege with Atty Breun. Colloquy w/ Atty Ruby in regards to the Jury Trial and the Sullivan analysis. If defn is successful in this motion, case would go to trial on cts 1, 2, 3, 6, and 7. Witness Laura Breun duly sworn and testified. Direct exam by Atty Ruby. Cross exam by ADA Miller. Redirect exam by Atty Ruby. Witness excused at 10:37 a.m. CT advises, if defn has a new trial, there would need to be new seperate rulings on the other acts motion. Argument by Atty Ruby. CT advised not prepared to make a ruling today, and would like a transcript of testimony today. CT advised would need written argument from the State. CT advises to Atty Ruby that the appeals deadline would need to be extended. Transcript should be completed by 6/1. State to file written response brief to motion by 7/9/18; Atty Ruby to file response brief by 8/1/18. CT to make decision within 60-90 days.

Reporter: Heather Kieta
Day 3 - State's evidence continued - testimony and exhibits; State rested; Defendant's evidence - testimony and exhibits; Defendant rested; jury panel removed from courtroom; jury instruction conference on the record; Court and counsel approved final jury instructions and verdict forms; jury panel present in courtroom; Court gave final jury instructions; closing argument by Atty Raymond for the State; closing argument by Atty Breun for the Defendant; rebuttal argument by Atty Sattler for the State; Juror 4 chosen as the alternate juror and excused; Court continued giving final jury instructions; bailiff sworn by clerk; jury removed for deliberations; Court and counsel reconvened periodically to answer jury questions; Court reconvened with jury panel present; presiding juror advised they had reached their verdicts; Court read verdicts into the record; Count 1 - Guilty; Count 2 - Guilty; Count 3 - Guilty; Count 4 - Not Guilty; Count 5 - Not Guilty; Count 6 - Guilty; Count 7 - Guilty (use of a dangerous weapon enhancer - not guilty); Court polled jurors individually; Court gave closing instructions; jury panel excused; Atty Sattler moved for judgment on the verdicts for Counts 1, 2, 3, 6 and 7; Atty White moved for judgment not withstanding the verdict on Count 6 and judgment of acquittal on Counts 4 and 5; Court granted Atty Sattler's motion and denied Atty White's motion; Court entered judgment of guilty on Counts 1, 2, 3, 6 and 7 and judgment of not guilty on Counts 4 and 5; Court revoked bail and ordered a presentence investigation be completed; Court adjourned

Reporter: Heather Kieta
Day 2 - State's evidence continued - testimony and exhibits; witness advised the State that they recognized a juror; Court and counsel questioned witness; Court and counsel questioned juror as to his relationship with the witness and other people that were on the witness list or other people whose names were discussed during testimony; Court and counsel agreed juror should be excused for cause; Juror 13 excused; State's case continued with testimony and exhibits; Court adjourned
Preliminary

Reporter: Heather Kieta
Courtroom without jury panel present; Court and counsel discussed pretrial issues and counsel approved preliminary instructions; jury panel present in courtroom and sworn by clerk; Court read preliminary instructions; opening statements by counsel; State's evidence - testimony and exhibits; Court adjourned

Reporter: Heather Kieta - Ct. room w/o jurors present.   Ct. & counsel discussed pretrial issues.  Ct. grants motion to remove all witnesses from ct. room except Detective Armstrong.  Ct. addressed state's 2nd motion in limine.  Argument by Atty Breun regarding other acts.  Re-direct argument by ADA Sattler.  Ct rules specific incidents should not be discussed without prior notification from State but can be discussed in general terms. Ct. held Ludwig hearing with defendant.  Prospective Jurors 1-24 in ct.room and seated in jury box, remainder of prospective jurors present in ct. room.  Ct. questions panel.  Juror 15 excused for cause, Juror 25 seated as replacement.  Voir dire by ADA Raymond.  Voir dire by Atty White.  Voir dire concluded 11:48.  INdividual voir dire of Jurors 2,3, 4,5, 9, 11,12, 13,17,18,21, & 22.  Jurors 5, 13, & 22 excused for cause and replaced by jurors 26,27,28.  Ct questions jurors 26,27,28.  Juror 28 excused for cause and replaced by juror 29. Individual voir dire concludes and jurors not chosen excused at 1:21.  Strikes exercised by counsel, 5 each.  No Batson objections. 14 jurors chosen for panel.  Ct. admonished jurors.  All jurors excused at 1:32 pm.  Impaneling concludes at 1:35.
State's Second

Reporter:  Heather Kieta
Ct to seat jury panel of 14 jurors (2 alternates). Counsel to have 5 strikes each.  Ct. will conduct individual voir dire of prospective jurors if necessary.  Counsel agree on prior convictions of Stae's Witnesses.  State's motion to introduce expert terstimony. Counsel agreed on testimony to be elicited from witness Westpahl as to strangulation.  State's Motions in limine.  Ct ordered all witnesses are excluded from courtroom commencing 10-26-16.  Defendant's mtoin as to using the word 'victim".  Ct. will not prohibit the State from using the words "victim" or "defendant" - motion is denied.  Defendant's motion to prohibit witness from beting accompanied by a pet - Motion granted. 1 - 5 granted.  Defn's motion to admit other acts (witness Stephenson) Ct. denied motion and excluded evidence.  Defn's motions in limine - B - denied.  Ct. to conduct Ludwig hearing prior to jury selection
